title.narrative: LEGISLATION, STRATEGIES AND GUIDELINES

description.narrative: GoT addresses priority gaps in legislation, strategies and guidelines to protect children and women from abuse, violence and exploitation, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection â€“ General, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect of children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: GoT addresses priority gaps in legislation, strategies and guidelines to protect children and women from abuse, violence andexploitation

description.narrative: GoT addresses priority gaps in legislation, strategies and guidelines to protect children and women from abuse, violence and exploitation | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/07/2016

title.narrative: % of under-5 children with birth certificates in 5 selected regions

baseline.value: 15% of U5 children are registered with the civil authorities in Mainland Tanzania, 6% of children have a birth certificate in Mainland Tanzania

target.value: 2016:At least 46% of U-5 children in 4 regions provided with birth certificates

actual.value: 2016:In Mwanza, the level of certification has increased by 37.3%, and in Mbeya by 51% taking the certification standards in these two regions to 49% and 62% respectively.

title.narrative: Status of GOT legislation, strategies and guidelines addressing abuse, violence and exploitation against children and women

baseline.value: Presence of Anti-Trafficking Act and the LCA, no regulations and implementation strategy, Inadequate enforcement of legislation and regulations with regard to GBV

target.value: 2016:Regulatory framework finalized in Mainland and Zanzibar, inlcuding addressing traficking, FGM and child marriage

actual.value: 2016:Nine (9) child protection regulations (listed above) that were gazetted in the previous reporting period have been translated. All English and Swahili versions of the regulations are printed. The Fit Persons Regulations, which will provide guidance on the provision of emergency foster care services
